verses.text: Bless the \sc Lord\sc*, O my soul: And all that is within me, \add bless\add* his holy name.
Bless the \sc Lord\sc*, O my soul, And forget not all his benefits:
Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; Who healeth all thy diseases;
Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; Who crowneth thee \add with\add* lovingkindness and tender mercies;
Who satisfieth thy mouth with good \add things;\add* \add So that\add* thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
The \sc Lord\sc* executeth righteousness And judgment for all that are oppressed.
He made known his ways unto Moses, His acts unto the children of Israel.
The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* merciful and gracious, Slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.
He will not always chide: Neither will he keep \add his anger\add* for ever.
He hath not dealt with us after our sins; Nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
For as the heaven is high above the earth, \add So\add* great is his mercy toward them that fear him.
As far as the east is from the west, \add So\add* far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
Like as a father pitieth \add his\add* children, \add So\add* the \sc Lord\sc* pitieth them that fear him.
For he knoweth our frame; He remembereth that we \add are\add* dust.
\add As for\add* man, his days \add are\add* as grass: As a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; And the place thereof shall know it no more.
But the mercy of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, And his righteousness unto children’s children;
To such as keep his covenant, And to those that remember his commandments to do them.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath prepared his throne in the heavens; And his kingdom ruleth over all.
Bless the \sc Lord\sc*, ye his angels, That excel in strength, that do his commandments, Hearkening unto the voice of his word.
Bless ye the \sc Lord\sc*, all ye his hosts; Ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
Bless the \sc Lord\sc*, all his works In all places of his dominion: Bless the \sc Lord\sc*, O my soul.
